# part g
```{r}
banana_data <- data.frame(
  RipeningTime = c(
    87.33, 75.5, 99.67,   # Bag
    75.83, 34.83, 86.5,   # Wrap
    104.17, 71.17, 122.5, # Bag+Wrap
    51.67, 31.83, 46.17   # Neither
  ),
  Treatment = factor(rep(c("Bag", "Wrap", "BagWrap", "Neither"), each = 3)),
  Type = factor(rep(c("Organic", "Nonorganic", "Mini"), times = 4))
)

banana_data

model_block <- aov(RipeningTime ~ Treatment + Type, data = banana_data)

summary(model_block)
```


# part k
```{r}
TukeyHSD(model_block, "Treatment")
```

## Based on the chart above, this is an interpretation of each comparison at 5%

### Bag-Wrap: p = 0.14, not significant
### Bag-Both: p = 0.54, not significant
### Bag-Neither: p = 0.0076, significant
### Wrap-Both: p = 0.0276, significant
### Wrap-Neither: p = 0.13, not significant 
### Both-Neither: p = 0.0023, significant
